Reviews.Title: “Get Away”
Reviews.Author: BigMike48
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 days never are displeased with our stay here. Excellent people are alway helpful to help with anything that comes up. Has nice pool and hot tub nice breckfast everyday. Shuttle to Silver Dollar City.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient to Silver Dollar City”
Reviews.Author: BobSnowedn
Reviews.Content: We popped in for a one night stay in Branson without reservations (something we NEVER do) and ended up in the Best Western. Price was reasonable (under $100) and the room was fairly large with a very comfortable king sized bed. The room also had a desk and business chair, and a Lazy boy type chair. The bathroom was clean and good sized.. The staff was excellent. It has free Wi-Fi and a business center,. There's a restaurant there, but we didn't have occasion to use it. The hotel has a complimentary hot breakfast. For us, it was scrambled eggs, biscuits and gravy, two choices of sausage along with fresh and canned fruit, an assortment of pastries, three types of juice, coffee, cereal, hard boiled eggs and probably a few othre items. The hotel was within 1/2 mile of Silver Dollar City. They have a free shuttle, but since we were just a one night stay, we didn't use it. We've stayed in other hotels near Silver Dollar CIty, but this may be the nicest place in the immediate area.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Agalia B
Reviews.Content: Stayed with my 14y/o granddaughters for 2 nights for a Silver Dollar City "spoil 'em" weekend. This is definitely an older building but the rooms have been updated recently. I was impressed how nice the room felt, especially the bathroom. The beds had a pillow top feel, bedding was clean, and the bed didn't squeak every time I had to get up. It was almost eerily quiet in the room. Would have thought we were the only ones there but a full parking lot attested differently. I could never get the keycard to work but my grandaughter had no trouble with it. The hallways are somewhat institutional, monotone whitewash walls and tired, worn carpeting. The pool area was large, surrounded by windows and sliding glass doors. It was an extremely hot evening so the air flow was welcome. The hot tub is fiberglass and felt clean and temperature correct but the water flow is minimal. Was also nice that I could watch my girls in the pool from the hot tub. Pool hours were great, staying open til midnight. There is a kiddie pool, also. Breakfast fare was pretty standard but the room was above standard with 2 walls of windows and plenty of seating. Beats the usual cubby hole breakfast areas. The staff at the desk are excellent, very friendly. Location is ideal for SDC and being able to enjoy Branson without suffering maddening traffic. It is next to SDC and was great to come back to the room at will to freshen up, rest, and go again. We didn't use the shuttle but can see how that would be nice with little kids and strollers. I would have liked to have had a microwave and fridge but I didn't ask for these specifically. The shampoo sample is tiny considering had 3 women in the room so I was glad I thought to bring my own. Also, if I had gotten a receipt for the room under my door, I wouldn't have had to check out at the desk. Overall, I am happy I chose to stay here. I plan to return with the next age group of grand kids.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location with updated rooms”
Reviews.Author: Cityhorsegirl
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here twice this summer while visiting Silver Dollar City. We selected the hotel based on location, and that aspect is very convenient. Quick, easy drive to the park. I was surprised that the rooms have been so nicely updated. Fresh paint, carpet, bedding, granite counter and new bathroom fixtures The clerk said flatscreen tvs were on order, and that will be a good upgrade. The hallways are very dated, which seems odd since the lobby and rooms have both been redone. Again, the clerk said the hallways were on the list of improvements to be made, so that will be great when complete. Did not use the indoor pools, but did take a look at them. The small round kiddie pool looked perfect for little ones to splash around in, and the regular pool was large. Both pools and the hot tub appeared clean and well maintained. The staff is very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Good location for Silver Dollar City, Friendly Staff, A Bit Dated”
Reviews.Author: Dahlgren_ILLakelover
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a king suite on the 3rd floor and our friends were in the connecting room, which was very convenient. The rooms are fairly comfortable and were pretty clean, but super dated. The front dest staff was incredibly helpful and friendly and the shuttle bus to Silver Dollar City is a really nice benefit of staying here. The breakfast is average and seemed to be the same thing every morning, but the dining room is large and accomodates folks comfortably. The kids in our party loved the game room and the indoor pool was extremely clean, but HOT! It would have been nice to have a little air moving in the pool room! If you are going to SDC, this is a great place to stay with kids. It is a bit dated, but excellent staff and our room was clean. My only complaint was the balcony outside our room was not clean - in fact, there were cigarette butts everywhere. This place is good for a couple nights, but I wouldn't stay here any longer than that.

Reviews.Title: “Good set of aminities, but kind of old looking...”
Reviews.Author: Stan S
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a king suite on the ground floor. The TV was an old tube model. The internet did not function half the time. The staff was very kind from the front desk to the room maid: All very kind and considerate. Location was close to Silver Dollar City, so was great to my kids. Pool was indoors and clean. The hallways and facilities seemed old and delapidated, but was acceptable for the price paid. No elevator was not a problem since we were on the bottom, but could be an issue if you are on the top floor (3 floors). The hotel seemed like an enclosed motel.

Reviews.Title: “Okay for a night but not for a week”
Reviews.Author: Retraction
Reviews.Content: We just spent 5 nights at the Branson Inn & Conference Center. This is an older hotel. The paint in the hallways does not match and the carpets are old and yuck. I believe they are doing some remodeling, because the carpet borders/baseboards were being ripped off during our stay. Also, at 8 am, a construction crew began hammering, running saws and ripping things out of the room next to our's. Unfortunately, this was a morning that I really needed and wanted to sleep in. I asked for another room, and they didn't have any. I asked for a refund, and they couldn't give me one. Our family of four also had a hard time in their small rooms. And with no microwaves or refrigerators in the rooms, there is now way to keep and warm all of the yummy left-overs that we had. Upon leaving the room, I looked under the beds for one of my kid's toys and found water bottles and trash from another family. I was grossed out. On the up side, the kids enjoyed the pool, they have a good breakfast and there is a place to do laundry. With all of our experiences here, I don't think that I would recommend this place to any of my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Good Experience”
Reviews.Author: BroncoRB
Reviews.Content: We didn't have any problems. Our room was clean, the breakfast was just fine but it was the same things EVERY day, watched the lady wipe the chairs, chair legs, tables and all around the food with the same towel and even after she had dropped it on the floor. Maybe add some mustard and mayo would be nice for turning eggs and sausage into sandwiches. Liked the pool area and game room. We took the shuttle to SDC. That was convenient even though we had to wait for them to return with the previous load-to and from. The shuttle driver seemed like it was a just a job that he didn't want to really be doing. However, the "private balcony in every room" they talk about is only about 2 feet wide and not really much a view. Overall a pleasant experience. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect facility to bring people together for a meeting!”
Reviews.Author: Mary P
Reviews.Content: We have been doing business meetings at this location twice a year for several years. Typically we draw attendees from Missouri, Illinois, Arkansas, Oklahoma, Kansas and Nebraska. Everyone LOVES this hotel and meeting space! The huge pool area including hot tub is awesome and provides the perfect place to "wind down" and relax. We always receive friendly and professional service. Special THANKS to staff members Paula D., Jeff M. and Jim H. who went above and beyond to make our recent event/stay fabulous!!!

Reviews.Title: “George was awesome he made us feel right at home, because of him we would stay again!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Trotter777
Reviews.Content: The Front Desk clerk George was Awesome my husband and I were on our 2nd year anniversary to Branson and George was so patient with us and kind, he gave us lots of restaurants to go to and attractions to go see, he handed us a map and guided us through the map so we knew where we were going and gave us routes to miss all the traffic. He made us feel right at home!!!! When we were running a few seconds late for the shuttle he held it up for us!! What an Awesome trip WE had!! We would recommend this hotel to anyone because of George!!! Thanks George you help make our Anniversary a memorable one!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Best Western located next to Silver Dollar City”
Reviews.Author: lovetotravelmore
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel a few hours early and was greeted by three people behind the desk who were very friendly and welcoming. They provided early check in, map of the hotel, transportation times they provide to and from Silver Dollar City. Room was nice and large, very clean. Ice and vending machines right down the hall, pool area looked nice (although we didn't have time to use it), laundry area available which is always a plus when you're traveling! We drove our own car to Silver Dollar City, but we did see many families with small children taking advantage of the hotel transportation to the park. The parking at Silver Dollar City gets very crowded so it would be a huge plus to get dropped of right in front of the gate and picked up there as well especially if you have small children. Elevators were quick, and the hotel has a luggage cart so you don't have to make multiple trips to and from your car. They will even provide ice for your coolers! The breakfast area was very large and clean, the food was laid out nicely and had a better selection than some of the Best Westerns we've been to. The air conditioner was a little noisy, but we are used to central air at home so I'm sure that's why it woke me up a few times. The beds were wonderful! Plenty of pillows and towels provided that were nice bright white. Carpeting in the rooms look brand new. We enjoyed our stay at this hotel, and would stay again when visiting Branson.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay if your visiting Silver Dollar City”
Reviews.Author: urroyalone
Reviews.Content: I brought my daughter and nephew to Silver Dollar City and we stayed at this Best Western. The rooms were modest and clean. The continental breakfast was great. The pool was indoor and was clean and the hot tub way great. My nephew enjoyed the game room and the hotel offers a shuttle every couple of hours to Silver Dollar City. I didn't realize until our last day there that their was a communal area on the third floor that looked like a great place to spend time with groups.

Reviews.Title: “Overall stay”
Reviews.Author: halimgist
Reviews.Content: The front desk was very helpful. For the price it was good. Close to sliver dollar city a ways aways from the strip. Would stay again.. all three of my kids loved the hotel and loved the indoor pool.

Reviews.Title: “Super Close to Silver Dollar City and Super Quiet”
Reviews.Author: Matthew H
Reviews.Content: I am a contractor and also a meeting planner for trade classes that we teach and we stayed at this site to check it out. My wife and I stayed here with five (out of seven) of our kids. We booked two ajoining rooms with two queens in each room. Lots of extras in the bathroom, even fresh razors for the ladies. We had just drove in from Ft Benning, GA area (about 12 hour drive) and we were looking to shut down. The place was very quiet and we didn't hear anyone else. So we slept great. This is a quiet hotel. If you want to stay close to Silver Dollar City, this may be your place. There are also lots of condos for rent in the area as well. We found the whole area to be very quiet. The hotel is easy to get to from the strip, but far enough away that you don't have the traffic jam of the strip. Lots of back ways into this sight with NO traffic. They have a big parking lot so you can bring your boat. It is a short drive from the State Park Marina if you want to fish Table Rock Lake. There is an easy back way to the public launch on Tanneycomo if you're going for the trout and don't like the idea of dragging your boat down the strip. I get that. This place is not the Cheateu on the Lake. But the Cheateu is double the price. This place is clean and they treat you like family. If you don't have a Hilton budget, this is a nice place and we will be back. Rates for everything in Branson do vary greatly depending on the time of year. So buzy times cost more and slow times cost less.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice staff, average motel”
Reviews.Author: travelplan24
Reviews.Content: I realized what a hotel snob I have become when I first thought of this hotel as .... Bleh and yuck. Actually for what it is, they do a nice job. Staff is very nice, the rooms are clean and some attempts have been made at updates: new paint in rooms, new comforter and drapes, nicely chosen. But at the heart this is an old motel. Excellent location if you are going to Silver Dollar City, clean, if simply serviceable, indoor pool for your kids. Warning: there is no restaurant for dinner and no alcohol served on the property. If you need a cocktail after a long day at the theme park with kids, bring your own!

Reviews.Title: “awesome shuttle service to Silver Dollar City”
Reviews.Author: Paula D
Reviews.Content: Hotel is a a awesome location to Silver Dollar City with a shuttle bus back & forth. Breakfast was great & heated INDOOR pool & game room for the kids. All staff encountered were down home friendly especially nice & helpful front desk staff.

Reviews.Title: “OK Hotel,”
Reviews.Author: Cass G
Reviews.Content: The room was nice and clean, It has a very nice selection for your free Breakfast. Customer Service was helpful when I called before arriving and front desk personal was friendly and helpful. The lady that sat out the breakfast was friendly. Free shuttle to Silver Dollar City. I can not comment on the pool since we did not attempt to use it. The bed was very noisy and rather uncomfortable, room did not come with fridge or microwave.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our Stay”
Reviews.Author: Scott M
Reviews.Content: Everything about this hotel was nice and I wouldn’t complain about anything, We stayed here because of the location and cost. It was a little more money than I would have anticipated paying for the room, but I attribute it to being peak time (Thanksgiving weekend). Overall, it was a good value compared to the other places I researched. The location is far enough from the main strip, but still close to everything. You can miss most of the traffic if you want to avoid Branson chaos via alternate routes. Branson West is just down the road with several restaurants and a Wal-Mart. The benefits of having a pool, hot tub (not whirl pool), kiddy pool, game room as well as complimentary breakfast made this a great family stay. They also offered a couple of checker boards in the common areas to play. We elected to upgrade to a suite as we wanted a refrigerator and a little more room for our extended stay. Others in our party stayed in the standard rooms and were happy with their accommodations. The rooms are clean and comforable. Also, the staff was very helpful in assisting us on our room decision and the staff was very friendly and courteous with every interaction. They truly desired to please their guests. We saw 3 plays with ‘A Christmas Snow’ being my favorite. We also spent a day at Silver Dollar City, which was a blast for my 12 & 10 children, their cousins & several adults – 5 families. This hotel is convenient to everything and a good value. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Ok hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kaylamg
Reviews.Content: Hotel is alright, nothing special. Hotel advertises heated pool but pool was ice cold. Hot tub was overcrowded with adults and children. Very convenient to silver dollar city. Doors to rooms are on the inside.

Reviews.Title: “Decieved by DESCRIPTION!”
Reviews.Author: ron m
Reviews.Content: We stayed Nov 15&16th 2011. booked and paid in advance for 2 queens per discription. Hotel and service was OK. Room was not as described. Both beds were broken down with squeaks anjd a large depression in one of them. No pillowtop mattresses or premium bedding as described. Beds need to be replaced. had to call to get bathroom cleaned on second day at 4:00 in the afternoon. Very disappointed with this Best Western as we have stayed at far better! I would not have stayed at this property if I had not paid in advance because i new I could not get a refund. This property was very overpriced at $76.00 a nite. Many more better hotels in this area at the same price or cheaper!!!

Reviews.Title: “Just ok”
Reviews.Author: NowataOKDenise
Reviews.Content: We've stayed here a few times because of the location. You can miss most of the traffic from Branson if you are heading to SDC. Branson West is just down the road with several restaurants and a Walmart if you want to avoid Branson chaos. This trip, I traveled with just my 11 year old girls. The staff put us on the bottom floor so the girls would have easy access to the pool. I don't think they've done the updating there yet. Halls were in bad shape and the room was just so-so. One bedspread was dirty and the heater didn't work properly. Our room was freezing when we got there about 8. I called the desk for more blankets and was told the maintenance man was still there and could come look at the heater. He just told me to turn the thermostat down from 73 to 68 like I was too dumb. Okay so I turned it down to 65 but it still just blew cool air all night! Glad we had extra blankets. The breakfast isn't advertised anywhere in the room, and I wasn't informed upon check-in so we didn't remember they served breakfast. They had some sort of convention and were very busy so I had to pay $79 for a room.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay there again.”
Reviews.Author: Michael C
Reviews.Content: Easy access to Silver Dollar City via a free shuttle. Easy drive into town to see the shows on the strip. The place was immaculate. The bathrooms have been updated recently. Everything in our room was in good shape. The hot breakfast buffet was better than what is at most places but certainly wasn't deluxe. We did eat there everyday. I was especially impressed by the pool and hot tub area. The pool looked brand new and it was very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Branson Inn and Conference Center, our choice for over 30 years”
Reviews.Author: Bill M
Reviews.Content: This Best Western motel has been our family choice since the 70's when we took our kids to Silver Dollar City. Then grand-kids and now with friends. It is roomy, clean, and the staff is friendly and very accommodating There is a shuttle to SDC and a very good breakfast buffet. The rates are reasonable, it has a nice pool and hot tub and the best part it is in West Branson and out of the hustle and bustle of downtown Branson. Yet it is only a few minutes to downtown except near evening show times.

Reviews.Title: “Family”
Reviews.Author: Julia S
Reviews.Content: Every year for the past 8 years my parents take our family to Silver Dollar City. Best Western is affordable, clean and close to Silver Dollar City. I have to say this year 2011 we had the best breakfast. Thanks to the Chef!!!! Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “We LOVED Branson and the People!”
Reviews.Author: Hawk_Man02
Reviews.Content: The Best Western Branson Inn in Branson West is a decent place to stay and we will stay here again. The rooms were clean, the staff was very friendly, it's away from all the downtown traffic and not even a mile down the road from Silver Dollar City. Yes, it's a Best Western and it's a little dated, but we were comfortable and our kids loved this hotel so 'nuff said. We've never been to Branson and we can't wait to go back. The locals were so friendly! We continued to run into people who just wanted to talk, wanted to know where we were from, how we were doing and if we were enjoying ourselves. We just couldn't get over how nice everyone was! I didn't matter if we were at a restaurant or Walgreens, everyone was super friendly. I've been to a lot of places and the people in Branson were the best! We will go back for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: JJKC59
Reviews.Content: If you want to be away from all the noise of the strip and be close to Silver Dollar City this is a good place to stay. It's not fancy but it was a good price the staff was helpful . There was a nice breakfast and a shuttle. I would stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient for Silver Dollar City”
Reviews.Author: JoePritchett
Reviews.Content: Reviewing this hotel is simple. It exists because of Silver Dollar City, it's full of families and kids and it's a little off the beaten path. We enjoyed our stay. SDC is right down the road, and that's not a joke. The breakfast is very good, lots of options, and a very large seating area. This hotel knows its audience. People who stay here go to Silver Dollar City. Just know what you are getting into. A somewhat dated hotel, kids running rampant, but solid service, a good-sized indoor pool, game room, etc. I had a noise issue one night, but I got it promptly taken care of. Keep your A/C unit on high, understand where you are at, and this is a very nice place to stay. The breakfast, again, was beyond what I had envisioned. And Silver Dollar City is amazing. Branson is great. A great option for families.

Reviews.Title: “We always like it here and we'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: klmiller
Reviews.Content: WE always stay here because we miss the traffic from Branson. We enjoy the friendly staff. The breakfast is very good. We can get to anywhere around Branson and Silver Dollar City from here.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: ArkansasFamilyMan
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for our family (me, wife, 4yr daughter 18 month daughter) based on a family member recommendation. Our plan was to drive up Thursday evening and then do SDC Friday. Check in was smooth. Even though the hotel is older, the room was what I expected, actually even better because the beds were really comfortable. The pool that night was perfect. There is a little pool maybe a foot deep that my little one enjoyed. The big pool is huge. There is also a hot tub that was really nice. It was raining that evening and there were a few leaks, but no big deal. Slept really good and got up early for a great breakfast. They had eggs, sausage, bisquits and gravy, french toast, fruit, cereal, juices, yogurt, all you can eat. We were really impressed with breakfast and the dining room is huge. We took the 9:30 shuttle to SDC which opened at 10:00. I love that they dropped us right at the front door! We have been to SDC many times, but never at opening. They have a flag raising ceremony with veterans from the crowd that is really neat. The 3:00 shuttle was on time and got went straight to our car which we left parked at the hotel. The only thing that I was a tad diappointed in was the wireless internet. The signal was not strong to get on the ipad, but not a big deal. I would definitely recommend especially if you are going to SDC.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay away from Branson but still close to everything”
Reviews.Author: dorsalmo
Reviews.Content: Great location near Silver Dollar City - not in the hubbub of Branson (not that we mind that, but some do), but not too far from everything. The place is a bit dated in some ways, but they keep it very clean. The complimentary continental deluxe breakfast is great. The pool and hot tub were a hit with my boys. It was nice to have an indoor pool at a place out of town - especially since we were there in late October. One negative was the wireless Internet - nice to have, but very hard to pick up due to the concrete block construction of the walls. I did manage to get a signal eventually, though. There was also a small issue with our bill regarding a rollaway bed, but the front desk staff handled it and were friendly - even late at night. Overall it's a very nice place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for the location and price”
Reviews.Author: KC2833
Reviews.Content: My husband (7 and 4 year old boys) and I just returned from a long weekend in Branson. This is the third time we have stayed at this hotel. We are pleased with the hotel. The location is great. My family does not like the busyness of Branson and with this hotel you get to miss all of this! You can go to West Branson (5 min away) and eat. We ate at a great pizza place called "Pizza by the Chef". Great service and food. It is right by the grocery store in town. We liked it so much we went there twice. My kids loved the pool. Yes, lots of cholorine, but I would rather have that then my kids getting sick from something. The pool is really big so even with lots of kids in it there was room. Yes, the room is not fancy, but that is not what we wanted and for the price I paid would not expect it. Our room was very clean and that is what matters the most to me. Also, the breakfast was fine for my family. I do agree it is a little noisy there if it is busy, but my family just brings a fan with us everywhere we travel. With the fan, it was not noisy at all and we all slept well. Would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “i felt ripped off”
Reviews.Author: bmc100
Reviews.Content: we checked in was told only room availab;e ffor our sat. nite stay was a king suite. so being latr friday nite said o.k. to this. also, there would be a 100 dollar room deposit to be held against any room damage. first time for me to hear this. room was freezing cold, no heat, took half an hour to warm up the room. bathroom ceiling tile was lifting up as tho someone was lifting it to work on the ventwork in the ceiling. next day we checked out. recieved our sdaturday nite money and deposit back for the coming saturday nite stay. rooms need updating, motel was very noisey.

Reviews.Title: “The PERFECT place for our family reunion”
Reviews.Author: FlaringOut
Reviews.Content: This Inn is amazing and has been the perfect accomodation for our trip. We've been treated like we were the only guests when in fact this wonderful place has been full with Silver Dollar CIty visitors. I brought my family of 14 including my sister's family from Alaska for a "Christmas Celebration" at the theme park. We arrived in the middle of a power failure caused by roadway construction work but we barely knew there was a problem. Our five rooms were available soon and we were so comfortable after our long drive from St. Louis. We used two handicapped rooms and a family suite (which was palatial!). The rooms were immaculately clean and accessible. The breakfast bar was a very pleasant surprise. The large inviting dining room has a great view of the Ozark woods and the bisquets and gravy, sausage, boiled eggs, pastries, fresh fruit and cerial not to mention juices and hot beverages were plentiful, hot and delicious. The shuttle service to the theme park was so accomodating for our large group and made coming and going so easy. It is also very close to the Lakes and state park. The children really enjoyed the beautiful indoor swimming pool. Finally we were so impressed by all the staff. They defined Christian hospitality and we couldn't have felt more welcome and pampered. Thank you for helping make this such a memorable weekend.

Reviews.Title: “I'd stay there again”
Reviews.Author: miesvander
Reviews.Content: I'd reserved a room online and arrived around 5:00 and the check-in was very fast. The room was nice with a king in the bedroom and a pull-out for the kids in the other room. The room had a microwave, fridge w/small freezer, sink, coffee maker, jacuzzi tub, and two balcony areas. We stayed on the third floor and used the elevator to bring bags up and then back down, but just used the stairs for the rest of the time since the elevator is on one side of the building and we we located on the other side. In the hallway there was a space that had some couches and a big screen TV, a small kitchen and a dining area. We didn't use any of it, but it was there to use I assume. I didn't use the pool, but my wife and 10 year old son did. They didn't stay very long since it was very crowded and pool had a lot of chlorine. In the morings I went down with my son and ate at the free breakfast. I had french toast, fruit, a donut and apple juice, and my boy had sausage, waffles, cereal and orange juice. We used the free shuttle ride over to Silver Dollar City (SDC), and they also picked us up at closing. They gave us a little print out that had the shuttle schedule on it. This is the main reason we stayed here since traffic has always been a pain for me at SDC, but this made it a breeze. Saturday afternoon my family and I stayed in the room to watch a football game and the housekeepers were very nice and friendly about working around us to clean up the room. We asked for a late check-out on Sunday (1:00) so we could hit SCD in the morning one last time, and it wasn't any problem. It's not too far from Branson, but the traffice to and from is always an extra hour and a half add -on and after walking around SDC all day you just kind of want to stay away from Branson but you just can't. Overall, it was a very nice stay and I will plan on staying here any time we are going to SDC.

Reviews.Title: “I expected better”
Reviews.Author: coz53
Reviews.Content: The hotel was not bad but I expected more for the price. We stayed there because of proximity to Silver Dollar City. Shuttle service was convenient. Try to use heated on cool evening and smell was so bad we had to turn it off. Indoor pool was nice but sauna did not work properly.

Reviews.Title: “Superior Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: LookNForAGoodDeal
Reviews.Content: This is the friendliest and the most customer service oriented hotel that we have ever stayed in. They are "over the top" on customer service. The staff are all SUPER friendly. We feel like we've made a bunch of new friends there in Branson. The shuttle service to SDC is what MADE our trip. The driver(s) made it fun and kept us laughing. The swimming pool/hot tub and SUPERB breakfast is the best! Good food and great staff! We loved the rooms and the bedspreads were the most up to date I've ever seen for a hotel. Some that I would actually consider having in my own home. They also provide game room and a laundry room for the guests. We didn't lack for anything while staying there. Their tax rate is much lower than staying in town and if one is going to SDC it's the PERFECT place to stay. THIS HOTEL is TOP NOTCH in our books. We will definately be staying here the next time we come to SDC!! =)

Reviews.Title: “Ok, reasonable price, good location if going to SDC”
Reviews.Author: jjinwaldo64131
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with 5 pre-teens on a quick trip to Silver Dollar City. Price was good, they say lodging tax is less in Branson West then in Branson. Reservied a double queen with a rollaway. Calling these Queens Beds was a stretch but the mattress on the bed was good and firm. The matress on the roll away was lumpy and old. Room was small be we squeezed 6 people in with no problems. The room was clean she shower head was great. THis is an aging motel that can needs some tender loving care to keep it from falling into the seedy category. The pool was large but water was cold, the hot tub was hot but jets did not work so you really just sit in a hot pool of water. Only 2 minutes from SDC so this was great. We could sleep a little later and not fight traffic to get to the park before it opened. The staff are great. Check in easy. I saw an older gentleman working his tai off be taking pillows, towels and roll aways to rooms. We left somethings in the room and I got a call on my cell phone while at SDC from the great staff. They held the things until we could pick them up on our way home. If you want clean, somewhat reasonable place to sleep close to SDC...this is the place. If you are looking for more try someplace else.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised for the price”
Reviews.Author: mhender1st
Reviews.Content: I have nothing but good things to say about my stay here. I was with my 2 sons, ages 14 and 9 and we all enjoyed the indoor pool and game room. The room was spotless, comfortable beds and an amazing shower head in large bathtub. I will recommend this hotel and plan to stay again on my next trip to Branson.

Reviews.Title: “Decent lodging next door to Silver Dollar City”
Reviews.Author: David55197
Reviews.Content: If you're focusing on Silver Dollar City for your Branson visit, this is one of the best-located hotels. It's so close to the park you can hear SDC's steam train whistling through the woods. The hotel's free shuttle delivers you right to the park's front gate in ten minutes or less. It's also convenient to the Highroad (465) and Highways 265 and 376, so you can easily bypass the Strip. The continental breakfast was more generous than I expected, with sausage and biscuits & gravy. The room was clean, spacious, and in good repair. However, it could have been more quiet. There are many families with kids, so be prepared for plenty of thumps and bumps until the kids wear themselves out. Warning: Don't trust Google Map directions to this hotel. It will lead you several miles away. Coming from Silver Dollar City or the Highroad, the hotel is on the left less than a half-mile past Indian Point Road.

Reviews.Title: “This is a wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: welschd
Reviews.Content: We greatly enjoyed our stay at this Best Western! The staff are so nice and helpful; the rooms are very clean; the location is close to Silver Dollar City (76 West). It's a great service that the Hotel offers of taking you to Silver Dollar City and back on their free shuttle bus. By being West on Hwy 76, you don't have to sit in traffic for an hour in the City); The hot breakfast is absolutely delicious and free (we saved a lot of money not going out to eat for breakfast each day). Thank you to Best Western! We will certainly stay there on all of our future visits!

Reviews.Title: “Will never stay here again”
Reviews.Author: LHSmith
Reviews.Content: My family and I Stayed here for 3 nights, the first full day we where there we came back to our room to find cash missing. It was proved that a housekeeper had entered our room while we were gone, while the do not disturb sign was on the door, and taken the cash we had in our room. The owner was not very apologetic and said we could be lieing, but they had enough information to terminate the housekeeper that took the money. And kindly let us know that for future reference there are safes at the front desk to keep things like that, which in my opinion should have been told on the front end and this situation probably would have never occurred. I will never stay here again or suggest anyone else does.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Enough”
Reviews.Author: ladyblue23
Reviews.Content: We spent four nights at this hotel and our stay was pleasant enough. The room was clean but there wa sno exhause fan in the bathroom which caused steam-up problems. The breakfast buffet was mostly bread products but decent enough, as long as you weren't on a carb restricted diet. The shuttle to SDC is not really convenient. The times are so restrictive that it is impossible to enjoy your day not knowing whether you might miss the shuttle and have to wait another two hours. The shuttle is often crowded and chances are you might not make it on the first trip. This was our second stay at this hotel and we decided due to the close proximity to SDC we would drive. My son left his down pillow at the motel and it took me two long distance calls to finally reach someone who would take care of mailing it to us (at our cost of course). I would stay at the motel again if we decide to return to SDC mainly due to the fact it is on the other side of SDC and there is no traffic from the the motel to the amusement park.

Reviews.Title: “Coulda been better”
Reviews.Author: treyJB
Reviews.Content: We just got back from our trip to Branson and stayed at this Best Western. The staff was very friendly - except the ladies who worked the breakfast bar. They were too busy to stop and be nice. But that's okay. I was a little disappointed with the room. When we got there, the kids noticed that the remote for the tv wasn't working. I went into the bathroom and noticed stains on the first washcloth I picked up. Not a good start. My husband had to go get new batteries for the remote and new washcloths. The remote STILL did not work when the new batteries were in. I could tell this hotel had been there for quite a few years. Just seemed very used. We also found the SDC shuttle not very helpful. One reason was that we noticed that it left at 9am, 11am, 3pm, etc. Well, we wanted to go at 9am and return at 12 or 1pm. We could not do that because the shuttle was not running at that time. We ended up just driving there. I rated this hotel average. Not good, not too bad. But I think I'll try another hotel next time.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful! WOnderful! Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: ddjburke
Reviews.Content: Best hotel I have stayed at in a long time! Clean, friendly, helpful,and wonderful! They were ever so helpful and kind!

Reviews.Title: “We had a great time thanks to all the staff for their great service”
Reviews.Author: american67
Reviews.Content: Our stay at Best Western was great. The staff were very accommodating and the service was excellent. We really enjoyed the shuttle and not having to drive to Silver Dollar City. The continental breakfast was fantastic and the kids spent many hours in the pool. Overall, you made our trip much more enjoyable. And one last note, we enjoyed the fact that everyone was speaking English.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased”
Reviews.Author: kansasfamily10
Reviews.Content: Just returned home from a Branson trip. The location was ideal--super close to SDC and an easy drive to the strip. It was nice to take in the scenery while driving back and forth. We stayed in a suite with a queen bed and a pull-out sofa sleeper with a jetted tub in the bath. Check in was a breeze. The staff were all very friendly, from the front desk to housekeeping. Pool area was nice. There was plenty of food to choose from at breakfast. I've read a lot of complaints regarding that, but it was nice being able to sit down and have something more than a bagel, which is what is all that's offered at many other places of this class. As far as the room, it was very clean and comfortable. There was a fan to use use in the bedroom area, which was nice. I fought with the pillows all night, but I think I'm just used to my own. It was very quiet even though the parking lot was full. We will definitely stay again on our next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful accommodation, dog friendly, a little expensive for dogs”
Reviews.Author: wld268
Reviews.Content: We love staying at the best western in Branson area, we bring our pets and can alway find a room and a friendly face and a good time. The only complaints we have is the cost for our pets it pushes up the cost to almost $100 per-night. That is a little pricey for us. restricting on the numbers of trip we can make and the number of nights we can stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to stay great service”
Reviews.Author: BigMike48
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have been staying here for the past 20 years. We have never been disappointed with are stays. We usually stay hear 5 or 6 times a year. The service has always been great. The staff here has always been helpful with anything that has come up. I could go on and on saying great things about this motel but you just have to come see for yourself. Mike & Linda Fitzpatrick Mounds, Okla.

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Memories”
Reviews.Author: Kimleessummit
Reviews.Content: Our family 3 day 2 night get away was wonderful. I traveled with my daughter and 13 yr old grandson. My daughter wants to come back with her girl friends for a week-end. She enjoyed the hot tub, pool, clean room, friendliness of staff, great location, view from room of wooded area and breakfast. My grandson enjoyed the game room, pool, comfortable beds, TV, and breakfast. He wants to come back with some of his buds. I enjoyed the decor of the room, comfortable beds, friendliness of statt, Free breakfast, Free shuttle to Silver Dollar City, Free ice for my Ice Chest, and reasonable rates. I want to come back with some of my Golden Girl friends and other family members.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: KC2833
Reviews.Content: My family and I just returned from a trip to Branson. This is our second stay in 4 years at this hotel. We will definately return again! The location is great. It is less than 5 min from Silver Dollar City. So when our kids were wore out and ready to get back to the hotel it did not take long at all. The rooms are clean and just what we needed. Nothing fancy, but for the money it was great and we were very comfortable. The pool is nice and heated which helped in November. The kids loved the pool and I liked the hot tub! The breakfast was ok. My kids and I enjoyed the cereal and doughnuts! Would recomend this hotel to anyone that is going to Silver Dollar City!

Reviews.Title: “This place is AWESOME!!!”
Reviews.Author: Vickie54
Reviews.Content: My aunt and I just returned from a trip to Branson. This hotel is absolutely the best place to be if you're going to Silver Dollar City. The pool area with the hot tub and heated indoor pool is worth the stay. The employees were very helpful and friendly. The breakfast beat most continental breakfast. Overall, there was not one thing to complain about. We loved it!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place. Close To SDC And The Rest Of Branson!”
Reviews.Author: lsghs2010
Reviews.Content: This hotel is just great. I have stayed here every time I have came with our church to the Church Of Christ weekend at SDC. If people are looking for a hotel that is close to SDC and far away from the strip, they should definitely stay here. I hope to becoming back next year with our church.

Reviews.Title: “Great Trip!”
Reviews.Author: brianwilliams68
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay! The kids enjoyed the pool and the service was great! Great Location!!!

Reviews.Title: “Will go back anytime!”
Reviews.Author: like2g0
Reviews.Content: We stayed here just before Christmas with relatives - couples from different states. The weather was mild and this Best Western was more than we expected. The breakfast buffet (included with room) was continental, delicious, and plenty to eat. The rooms were recently remodeled & decorated - and very clean & comfortable. It was a quiet location, backing up to woods. The indoor pool is large & heated (plus spa) with views to outside, definitely the guys favorite place. For us, there was no downside to tell about. It was a great experience, reasonable price and a super staff who were helpful in getting us oriented to Branson. We went to so many shows, did so much shopping - too bad we didn't spend more time here.

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay, very friendly”
Reviews.Author: lucilleCleveland
Reviews.Content: Staff excellent, Huge swimming Pool. Breakfast Very good. Transportation to the park. Rooms clean and big.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: LABuckeye62
Reviews.Content: Nice clean rooms, great indoor pool, private, quite location that is easily accessible to the entertainment district.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: dutch57
Reviews.Content: Clean and quiet place to stay in Branson Mo to get away from the rat race of hwy 76. Older place but very clean and update. Will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Close to Silver Dollar City”
Reviews.Author: dolver
Reviews.Content: I gave this an average rating. We were happy with our stay. I'm thinking it was about equal to other hotels in the area. Rooms were clean, hotel felt secure. It was within a 5 minute drive to Silver Dollar City. It was a drive to the "strip," but we preferred being out in the "country." Breakfast was kinda sad. Carbs carbs and more carbs. Would have loved to have seen some FRESH fruit (not canned- cuz it was warm and sour) Staff was helpful and friendly. Pool was clean and warm. It was also empty whenever we wanted to use it...which was wonderful! Fridges and Micros available for a fee. This is NOT a new hotel. It probably dates back to the 60's. However improvements have been made. Again, we were quite happy (and I'm picky) Probably not the best in the area, but also far from the worst.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, but bring your own pillow and skip the breakfast.”
Reviews.Author: megleo
Reviews.Content: We just completed a four-night stay as part of a big group (family reunion). Though we were a bit apprehensive as we drove up (there were several in our caravan who started joking about the hotel's resemblance to a maximum security prison as we pulled into the parking lot), we were met by super-friendly and accomodating staff. We ended-up needing to play a bit of musical rooms to get our families settled and the staff was very nice about all of our shuffling. That being said, the property itself is a bit ... odd. It's long and low and you feel a bit like a rat in a maze as you navigate from one place to another. Not a problem, just odd. The rooms were fine, with the exception of the lumpy pillows. They were so bad we bought our own at the nearby Walmart. The pool area is nice, but it was REALLY hot in there. My kids (eight and nine years old) loved it, but most of the adults didn't want to hang out in such a steamy place, so the over-20 crowd steered clear. The reason I had to give this location a "poor" rating and NOT recommend it is that the breakfast is appalling. First off, the hotel uses styrofoam plates, bowls and cups, and plastic cutlery. Hello, people -- are you living under a rock or do you just not care about overflowing landfills and the overall health of the planet? Disposable is just plain lazy and irresponsible. Shame on you. Besides, it's just plain icky to eat and drink with that stuff. Again, we made a trip to Walmart for some cheap glasses, mugs and cutlery for our family. And speaking of icky, the only edible thing here is the cereal. Boiled eggs are the sole protein source offered (aside from milk), and whoever prepares them must boil them for at least half an hour in order to achieve their rubber-like consistency. Inedible. The biscuits are salty enough to curl your tounge. Also inedible. There isn't a single whole grain to be found anywhere near the buffet area. Coffee is weak, fruit is canned and weird -- are those potatoes in there?? Really, how hard is it to put out some whole wheat bread, fresh bananas and apples and maybe a little yogurt? And what's the problem with using uncut oatmeal instead of that instant stuff if you're cooking it in a crock pot anyway? Giving a little thought to nutrition and conservation would go a long way here.

Reviews.Title: “Check your credit card statement for duplicate billing”
Reviews.Author: SAR17
Reviews.Content: We were double billed on our credit card for a one night stay. We called the hotel 3 times and only received excuses. Finally, after 7 months, we contacted Best Western Corporate offices who investigated the matter. They contacted the hotel, acknowledged the error, and issued a refund for the duplicate charge. However, we received no compensation for the inconvenience to us--and no interest for the use of our money for seven months. In our opinion, very poor customer service.

Reviews.Title: “We enjoyed our stay, it ended too soon!”
Reviews.Author: freenchrist
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel as part of a package that we did through Silver Dollar City. We loved every minute of our stay. The hotel was quiet and did not seem crowded. We took advantage of the breakfast and the shuttle. We would definately come back!

Reviews.Title: “We will likely stay again”
Reviews.Author: KansasAnnie
Reviews.Content: We and another couple stayed at this motel during Dec. 2008. I was responsible for selecting a motel, and after reading the reviews I was hesitant about taking this one. But they seemed to have been working on updating it and the manager gave reasonable responses to all the reviews both positive and negative. The deciding factor for me was the response he gave to the lady from Overland Park who could not find anything good about the place. That was classic and expressed my feelings exactly!!! The motel was nice, clean, and quiet. It was close to Silver Dollar City and a visit there was on our agenda. We were VERY appreciative of the shuttle bus especially after we witnessed the Christmas traffic to SDC on Saturday evening. The staff were friendly and more than helpful. The rooms were clean and comfortable. We cannot speak to the pool (although it LOOKED nice) since we did not use it. We also did not eat the breakfast because we chose to go out for a substantial meal at midmorning. We are anticipating another trip to Branson and will likely stay at this motel again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice! Great Quiet Location!”
Reviews.Author: Kid_Dynamite
Reviews.Content: Stayed here Nov 08 for the weekend. Very nice hotel! Breakfast is free & great...consist of Biscuits & gravy, donuts, boiled eggs, toast, cereal, milk, juices...etc. Staff is extremely friendly. Game room for the kids has about 5-8 arcade games, pool & air hockey. Indoor swimming pool & hot tub was very nice, has a towel rack there so you don’t need to bring one from your room. Location is just down from Silver Dollar City & a free shuttle is provided. On the location, if you are wanting to stay on the strip, this isn't the place for you...but it's not far from the strip & it's very quite & relaxing. On 2 occasions (dawn & dusk) I was able to look off my private balcony & see deer in the woods below. Many TV stations to chose from, great heating & air. On the floor I stayed on (3rd) I saw there is a large sitting area with many couches, a very large TV, kitchen & sink for guest usage. Only drawback in my opinion were the beds. The pillows were great, but the beds were a bit firm for my taste. Other than that, this was a great place to stay & I would come back anytime.

Reviews.Title: “Great pool!”
Reviews.Author: StLouyGal
Reviews.Content: Staff were all really great and the pool was especially nice. We stayed in a pet friendly room. The room was dated and had a slight odor but I guess that's about what you would expect for a pet room. Sliding glass doors opened to a large grassy area. This property is a little out of the way - just past the silver dollar city turnoff but we were there in the slow season and the drive wasn't bad at all. The indoor pool area was really nice. Pool was heated and pretty large. They also have a small child's wading pool and a hot tub.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: jsgreg
Reviews.Content: My husband, daughter and I stayed at this property the night of Aug 4. We were booked for a second night as well that we ended up cancelling. The hotel is very convenient to Silver Dollar City. The double room itself and the bathroom were very clean. The lobby is nice. We did not check out the pool area. Parking is good and no matter where your room is, it is accessible with little or no hassel. The beds are rock hard. They are bad enough that if I layed on my side, my arm and shoulder would start to ache and I would wake up. We had no blanket either on the beds or in the closet. The beds had a sheet and a comforter, and everyone knows not to use the comforter. The pillows were very nice however. It is an older hotel and it shows. The breakfast is barely edible. It consists of pre-made french toast and english muffins. Both are cold and sit next to a 4 slot toaster to be rewarmed. Don't get in a hurry if you need to rewarm your food because there is, no doubt, room for a traffic jam at the toaster. The french toast crumbles when you pick it up. There was also plain bread to make toast. There were biscuits and gravy. The gravy was fine. The bicuits are also pre-made. The bottom half inch of every biscuit we picked up was rock hard. We had to cut the bottom off to eat them to keep our teeth intact. There was cold cereal and milk, doughnuts, canned fruit of some sort, oatmeal, both pre-made in a crockpot and individual packets to mix with hot water, juices, coffee and hot tea. I tried the french toast, biscuits and gravy, cereal and coffee. The cereal and coffee were fine. There is a computer for public use. Do not expect to find it available. There were always children surfing the web, or on two occasions we tried to use it, there was an employee sitting there using it. In the less than 24hrs we were there, we tried to use the computer 7 times. I understand it is public, but 10 yr olds and employees ought to have some restrictions.

HotelInfo.Name: BEST WESTERN Branson Inn and Conference Center
HotelInfo.Address: 8514 State Hwy 76, Branson West, Branson, MO 65737
